bibl.title: John Bowler v. James H. Bennett. Complaint, Exhibit D
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court for the Third Judicial District of Washington

body.p: COMPLAINT Before C.D. EMERY, United States Commissioner, Seattle, Wash. No.107
United States of America, Territory of Washington, } ss. City of Seattle
John Bowler of Seattle in the County of King and Territory of Washington, being duly sworn, deposes and says that James H. Bennett

heretofore, to-wit, on the 15 day of June A.D. 1888, at Seattle in said Territory, having duly taken an oath before C.D. Emery ( he the said C.D. Emery being then and there a competenet officer, towit: a United States Commissioner duly commissioned acting and sworn and qualified to administer oaths) that he would testify declare and depose truly in a certain action then and there pending before the said Commissioner wherein the United States was Plaintiff and him the said James H. Bennett was defendant, did then and there wilfully corruptly and knowingly contrary to such oath wilfully under oath state and testify that he the said James H. Bennett did on the 15th. day of June A.D. 1888 at the harber of San Francisco in the State of California with brass knuckles make an assualt in and upon him the said John Bowler and him the said John Bowler with said brass knuckles did then and there beat and wound, the said statement by the said John Bowler then and there made and testified to being then and there a material matter in and upon the said hearing and which he the said John Bowler then and there believed and knew to be untrue

contrary to the form of the statute in such case made and provided, and against the prace and dignity of the United States of America. Wherefore the said deponent prays that the said John Bowler may be apprehended and dealt with according to law. And, furthermore, the said dependent prays that _____ who he has reason to believe, and does believe, are material witnesses to the subject of the matter of this Complaint, may be duly summoned to appear and give testimony thereto. (Signature) J.H. Bennett Sworn to and subscribed before me this 27th day of June A.D. 1888
